Les domaines d‚Äôactions pour atteindre la neutralit√© carbone sont multiples et les projets de la cat√©gorie Net 0 Carbone le sont tout autant.
Produire de l‚Äô√©nergie propre (solaire en l‚Äôoccurrence) est √† pr√©sent tout aussi important que d‚Äôacheminer des produits en limitant l‚Äôimpact carbone ou encore favoriser la r√©paration d‚Äôengins telecoms afin de les remettre en circulation.

The fields of action to reach carbon neutrality are multiple and so are the projects of the Net 0 Carbon category.
Producing clean energy (solar energy in this case) is now just as important as transporting products while limiting the carbon impact or promoting the repair of telecoms equipment in order to put them back into circulation.
These projects are a small illustration of the environmental commitment of Orange employees.
Projects¬† üëè Les fermes solaires/Carbonbusters/Ogreen

description:
Et si le num√©rique √©tait une des solutions pour lutter contre le r√©chauffement climatique ? 
Parce qu‚Äôil r√©duit les mobilit√©s, nous devons aussi mener les efforts pour r√©duire nos propres √©missions de CO2. Ainsi nous nous sommes engag√©s √† √™tre net z√©ro carbone d‚Äôici 2040 avec 10 ans d‚Äôavance sur les objectifs du secteur.
Nous prenons en compte nos propres actions et le mix √©lectrique des pays dans lesquels nous op√©rons pour orienter notre recours aux √©nergies renouvelables.


üì∏ @ibrahimnabeelphoto 


What if digital technology was one of the solutions to fight global warming? Because it reduces mobility, we must also lead efforts to reduce our own CO2 emissions. So we have committed to being net zero carbon by 2040, 10 years ahead of the industry's targets.
We are taking into account our own actions and the electricity mix of the countries in which we operate to guide our use of renewable energy.

Ces merveilles de technologie sont compos√©es de plastique, de verre, mais √©galement truff√©es de m√©taux pr√©cieux et terres rares en tr√®s petites quantit√©s. Elles sont encore tr√®s majoritairement le fruit d‚Äôun mod√®le d‚Äô√©conomie lin√©aire : extraction mini√®re, fabrication concentr√©e en Asie, renouvellement rapide et dur√©e de vie courte, avec peu de collecte et de recyclage.


üì∏ Daniel Beloumou


It‚Äôs therefore estimated that it takes around 70kg of raw material to make a 120g smartphone
These technological marvels are made up of plastic, glass and small quantities of precious metals and rare earth elements. In the main, they are also the product of a linear economy model: mining, manufacturing concentrated in Asia, fast renewal and short lifespan, with little collection or recycling.


#DigitalGoesGreen #OrangeGoesGreen
#recycling #recyclage #zerowaste #zerodechets

description:
‚ôªÔ∏è‚ôªÔ∏è Nous participons √† l‚Äôeffort de collecte aupr√®s des r√©parateurs locaux, avec le soutien √† la mise en place d‚Äôateliers de tris. Faute de fili√®re sur place, ces d√©chets sont ensuite achemin√©s en France pour y √™tre recycl√©s.
Le premier atelier a √©t√© inaugur√© au Burkina Faso en 2010.
Depuis, quatre autres ateliers ont ouvert au B√©nin, au Niger, en C√¥te d'Ivoire et ici, au Cameroun.
‚úÖ 30 emplois locaux ont √©t√© cr√©√©s,
et chaque ann√©e, pr√®s de 12 tonnes de d√©chets sont collect√©es par atelier (soit l'√©quivalent de 80 000 mobiles) et achemin√©es en France pour y √™tre revaloris√©es.

üì∏ Daniel Beloumou

We‚Äôre taking part in a collection initiative with local repair shops, supporting the effort by setting up sorting workshops.
In the absence of a local supply chain, this waste is then transported to France for recycling.
The first workshop was launched in Burkina Faso in 2010. Since then, four other workshops have opened in Benin, Niger, C√¥te d'Ivoire and and here, in Cameroon.
30 local jobs have been created
and each year, and nearly 12 tonnes of waste is collected per workshop (the equivalent of 80,000 mobiles) and transported to France for recycling.

‚ñ∂Ô∏è Voyageons √† Douala au Cameroun et d√©couvrons cette initiative pour collecter et recycler les d√©chets √©lectroniques.

A discovery of Douala in Cameroon and an initiative to collect and recycle electronic waste.
At each stage of the collection, we have to clean and sort the materials... because plastic and scrap metal are not recycled in the same way!
Most of this waste is exported from Cameroon to France at the Ateliers du Bocage.
Rare materials, such as gold or processors, are then extracted... as you know, nothing is lost: everything is transformed ‚ôª

description:

On va ensemble vers un num√©rique responsable ? Eco-concevoir, collecter, reconditionner, r√©parer, augmenter la dur√©e de vie des produits, recycler : voil√† les principes cl√©s de l‚Äô√©conomie circulaire.

description:

Satisfaire le client oui ! Mais la s√©curit√© avant tout, pour planifier, √©quiper, explorer, mesurer, diagnostiquer et r√©parer. üßê

Customer satisfaction, of course! But safety first to plan, equip, explore, measure, diagnose and repair.

description:
Le soleil ‚òÄÔ∏è c‚Äôest la vie, le soleil c‚Äôest l‚Äô√©nergie ‚òÄÔ∏è
Le saviez-vous ? Depuis 2018, Orange en Jordanie a r√©ussi √† r√©duire ses √©missions de CO2 de 45 kilotonnes gr√¢ce √† ses infrastructures solaires.

Pour √©viter d‚Äôavoir recours √† des groupes √©lectrog√®nes consommant du fuel (√©nergie fossile √©mettant du CO2), Orange met en place plusieurs initiatives telles que celles des panneaux solaires.
En Europe, nous avons commenc√© √† d√©ployer des panneaux solaires sur nos sites radio, en compl√©ment du raccordement au r√©seau √©lectrique local qui reste n√©cessaire.
Et en Afrique et au Moyen-Orient,  Orange acc√©l√®re ses projets li√©s au solaire pour atteindre le net z√©ro carbone d‚Äôici 2040.

üì∏ : @nicolasserve 

Let the sun shine ‚òÄÔ∏è
Did you know ? Since 2018, Orange in Jordan has succeeded in reducing its CO2 emissions by 45 kilotons thanks to its solar infrastructures.

To avoid having to use generators that consume fuel (fossil fuel that emits CO2), Orange is implementing several initiatives such as solar panels.
In Europe, we have started to deploy solar panels on our radio sites, in addition to the connection to the local electricity network, which is still necessary.
And in Africa and the Middle East, Orange is stepping up its solar-related projects to achieve net zero carbon by 2040.

#solarenergy #solarpanels 
#panneauxphotovolta√Øques #netcarbonzero #netzerocarbon #netzero2040 #climateaction #digitalgoesgreen #orangegoesgreen

Un des principaux impacts du num√©rique sur l‚Äôenvironnement est d√ª au cycle de vie des √©quipements √©lectroniques, en particulier des smartphones.
Un smartphone au placard, c‚Äôest un immense g√¢chis : recyclons !

üì∏ @odieuxboby 

Did you know?
One of the main impacts of technology on the environment is due to the lifecycle of electronic devices, in particular smartphones.

All of this is a bit invisible to the general public, but nevertheless risks depleting natural resources if we don't develop a circular economy for preserving them. It‚Äôs worth pointing out that 80% of a smartphone‚Äôs environmental impact is due to its manufacturing and end-of-life phases, and 20% occurs in-life, mainly due to recharging the battery.

#GlobalRecyclingDay #ZeroWaste #Recyclage #changinghabits #recycle #reuse #refurbish #greenhabits #circulareconomy #economiecirculaire

#bienvivreledigital #DigitalGoesGreen

Alexander Graham Bell d√©pose, le 14 f√©vrier 1876, le brevet √† l‚Äôorigine du t√©l√©phone.

#didyouknowthat 
Alexander Graham Bell filed the patent for the telephone on February 14, 1876.
145 years later, whether design, vintage or technological, it remains this object that allows people to connect, have fun and work.
Behind this object are hidden technical performances: transmission, network, numbering, 4G technologies and now 5G!
To know everything about this object that never leaves you, you could attend this cultural MOOC offered by the #fondationOrange
 
#network #technology #evolution
#Hello5G #4G #5G #MOOC

La Culture n'est que l'un des nombreux cas d‚Äôusage dans lesquels la 5G apportera des beÃÅneÃÅfices.

description:
Le plus innovant avec la 5G, c‚Äôest ce que nous en ferons.

The most innovative thing about 5G is what we'll do with it.
Children go on a pretend class trip to a museum, where almost anything is possible. As an exciting addition to our existing networks, 5G opens up a whole range of possibilities. Thanks to 5G, children can discover the museum as if they were actually there, enjoying a fun and immersive experience

description:
Faire du neuf avec vieux ! Le principe de l‚Äô√©conomie circulaire est justement de produire des biens et des services de mani√®re durable, en limitant la consommation et les gaspillages de ressources. Il rompt avec l‚Äô√©conomie lin√©aire traditionnelle (extraire, fabriquer, consommer, jeter), pour le bien de la plan√®te, et le n√¥tre ! 

üì∑ : @toddmclellan

-_-_-_-_-_-_-_-_-_-_-_-_-

New isn't always better ! The very idea of a circular economy is to produce goods and services in a sustainable way, thus limiting consumption and wastes of ressources. Far from the usual linear economy (extract, make, use, discard), for the good of our Planet, and ours !

description:

Everything is changing as Lavoisier would say!

From eco-design to collecting, reconditioning, repairing, recycling and increasing the overall lifespan of products: these are some of the key principles behind the circular economy. ¬´ Je viens d‚Äôune zone rurale de Tha√Ølande entour√©e de rizi√®res. Les agriculteurs vivent dans des maisons d√©labr√©es. J‚Äôai eu la chance de voir comment vivaient les agriculteurs au Japon : dans de meilleures conditions que dans mon pays. Je leur ai demand√© comment ils y arrivaient et ils m‚Äôont r√©pondu qu‚Äôils utilisaient la technologie. Cette r√©v√©lation m‚Äôa inspir√©e pour la cr√©ation de ListenField. Cela permet l‚Äôacc√®s √† une technologie de pr√©cision et √† une plateforme API d‚Äôanalyses des cultures afin de rendre l‚Äôagriculture durable et profitable. En mettant √† disposition la technologie, nous am√©liorons la vie de ces cultivateurs. On les aide √† rassembler des donn√©es. Ils ont ainsi un aper√ßu de la fa√ßon dont ils g√®rent leurs cultures : c‚Äôest bon pour eux, pour l‚Äôenvironnement et pour les consommateurs. Selon moi, la technologie devrait √™tre pens√©e pour r√©soudre les probl√®mes et cr√©er un d√©veloppement durable. ¬ª
Rassarin Chinnachodteeranun, CEO de ListenField
***
‚Äò‚ÄôI‚Äôm from a rural area of Thailand surrounded by rice fields. Farmers live in shabby houses. I had the chance to see how farmers live in Japan, in better conditions than in my country. I asked them how they managed that and they told me they were using technology. This revelation was my inspiration for creating ListenField. It provides precision technology and a farming analytics API platform in order to make agriculture sustainable and profitable. In providing technology, we can improve the farmers‚Äô lives. We can help them gather data and give them an insight into their way of farming so they have a better product. At the same time, we encourage them to turn to organic farming: it‚Äôs good for them, good for the environment and for the customers. In my opinion, technology should be thought of in a way of helping solve problems and create sustainability.‚Äô‚Äô
Rassarin Chinnachodteeranun, CEO of ListenField
¬© Orange/Webedia/Sipa/R.Olivie
#TechForGood #Tech #Human Inside
caption: Photo by Orange in Thailand.

description:
¬´ Il y a huit ans, j‚Äôai fait une ¬´ work expedition ¬ª dans la Silicone Valley. L√†, je me suis dit qu‚Äôil serait int√©ressant de digitaliser un objet aussi commun qu‚Äôune paire de lunettes, et port√© par des milliards de personnes. La premi√®re cause de mortalit√© sur la route est l‚Äôendormissement au volant. Avec les lunettes connect√©es Prudencee, j‚Äôesp√®re sauver des vies. Au volant, il y a la probl√©matique de la baisse de vigilance. Au travail, celle des troubles musculosquelettiques ou de la fatigue visuelle qui donnent des c√©phal√©es √† des millions d‚Äôemploy√©s. Chez les personnes √¢g√©es, celle de la chute. Les algorithmes que j‚Äôai d√©velopp√©s avec mes ing√©nieurs permettent de pr√©venir tous ces risques. Les nouvelles technologies doivent impacter le monde en le bonifiant et se mettre √† la disposition de l‚Äô√™tre humain pour qu‚Äôil vive mieux demain. ¬ª
Philippe Peyrard, CEO et fondateur de Ellcie Healthy
***
‚Äò‚ÄôEight years ago, I took part in a work expedition in the Silicon Valley. That's when I told myself that it would be interesting to digitalize an ordinary object utilized by billions of people such as a pair of glasses. On the road, the leading cause of death is falling asleep behind the wheel. With the Prudencee connected glasses, I'm hoping to save lives. At the wheel, there's the issue of the decrease of alertness. At work, musculoskeletal issues or ocular fatigue give headaches to millions of employees. Among the elderly, there's the problem of falling over. The algorithms that my engineers and I have developed can prevent all these risks. New technologies must have a positive impact on the world and be at the service of mankind for it to have a better life in the future. ‚Äò‚Äô
Philippe Peyrard, CEO and founder of Ellcie Healthy.
¬©Orange/Webedia/Sipa/L.Thebaud
#IOT #ObjetConnect√© #HumanInside
caption: Photo by Orange in Villeneuve-Loubet with @ellcie_healthy.

description:
¬´ L‚Äôasthme est une maladie de plus en plus fr√©quente. Il y a un lien √©vident avec la pollution. Jusqu‚Äôici, on interrogeait le patient asthmatique √† travers des questionnaires et des agendas de crise, pas toujours tr√®s fiables. L‚Äôid√©e de proposer un objet connect√© qui permet de tracker pr√©cis√©ment le moment o√π le patient a recours √† son traitement s‚Äôest alors impos√©e. C‚Äôest ainsi que Connect‚Äôinh est n√©. En tant que m√©decin, je pense que la technologie doit profiter au patient pour qu‚Äôil contr√¥le mieux sa maladie. Mais elle doit √™tre √©valu√©e avec des m√©thodes scientifiques robustes. Aujourd‚Äôhui, le monde la sant√© est submerg√© par les technologies. Beaucoup d‚Äôobjets connect√©s se d√©veloppent mais peu sont √©valu√©s selon des standards scientifiques. Ce lien de confiance ne peut passer que par l‚Äô√©valuation. ¬ª
St√©phane Schuck, CEO de Kap Code
***
‚Äò‚ÄôAsthma is a more and more common disease. It‚Äôs obviously linked to pollution. Until now, asthmatic patients were asked questions through surveys and attack diaries that were not always reliable. The idea was to offer a smart object that could track with precision the moment when the patients take their treatment. So that‚Äôs how Connect‚Äôinh was born. As a doctor, my opinion is that technology must be beneficial to the patient so that they have a better grip on their disease. But it needs to be assessed through strong scientific techniques. Nowadays, healthcare is flooded with technology. Many smart objects are being developed but few meet scientific standards. The confidence in such objects can only go through a thorough assessment.‚Äô‚Äô
St√©phane Schuck, CEO of Kap Code
¬©Vincent Colin
#ESant√© #IOT #HumanInside
caption: Photo by Orange in Paris, France with @kapcode.

description:
¬´ Je circule en v√©lo √† Paris. Les principales probl√©matiques rencontr√©es par les cyclistes sont la s√©curit√© et le manque de visibilit√©. Avec mon associ√©, nous nous sommes demand√©s comment faire pour d√©velopper la mobilit√© √† v√©lo. De l√† est n√© Le Galuchon. Ce sac √† dos lumineux et connect√© a √©t√© con√ßu en prenant en compte l‚Äôexp√©rience utilisateur. Il fallait qu‚Äôil convienne √† tout type d‚Äôusage : r√©gulier, irr√©gulier, improvis√©‚Ä¶ La technologie doit r√©pondre √† un usage r√©el, √† des probl√©matiques basiques pour √™tre durable. Je souhaite contribuer au d√©veloppement de villes plus propres, dans lesquelles il y aurait plus de mobilit√© active donc moins de voiture et de pollution. C‚Äôest essentiel pour rendre le territoire urbain √† ses habitants. ¬ª
L√©a Galice, co-fondatrice de Galanck
***
‚Äò‚ÄôI ride my bike around Paris. The main problems encountered by cyclists are the lack of visibility and security. My associate and I asked ourselves what we could do to improve the experience of riding a bike. Drawing from this, Le Galuchon was created. It‚Äôs a lit-up and connected backpack that takes the user experience into account. It needed to be suitable for any type of use: regular, scarce, on-the-fly‚Ä¶ Technology must be an answer to a real use and to basic issues in order to be sustainable. I want to contribute to developing cleaner cities where mobility would be active and thus less from cars meaning less pollution. The main goal is to give back the urban territories to their dwellers.‚Äò‚Äô
L√©a Galice, co-founder of Galanck
¬©Vincent Colin
#UrbanLife #Bike #GreenCity #HumanInside
caption: Photo by Orange in Paris, France with @laecigale.

description:
¬´ La location immobili√®re concerne 40% de la population fran√ßaise. Ce march√© n‚Äôa pas √©volu√© depuis 50 ans. Je viens du monde bancaire et j‚Äôai pu constater que les banques d√©laissent compl√®tement l‚Äôactivit√© de caution. Se porter caution de quelqu‚Äôun est un acte financier mais aussi et surtout un accompagnement moral. C‚Äôest pourquoi j‚Äôai d√©cid√© de cr√©er Cautioneo, sp√©cialiste de la caution digitale sur le march√© de la location. Le parcours traditionnel de location est long et rejette de nombreux profils : jeunes, CDD, freelances, chefs d‚Äôentreprise, seniors... L‚Äôid√©e est d‚Äôoffrir un produit qui r√©volutionne et simplifie le parcours-locataire, et qui soit accessible au plus grand nombre. Innover, c‚Äôest proposer des services utiles. La technologie doit √™tre au service des besoins quotidiens des Hommes. ¬ª
Julien Chenet, co-fondateur de Cautioneo
***
‚Äò‚Äô40% of French people are renting their home. This market has not evolved for 50 years. I come from the banking sector and I‚Äôve noticed that banks have neglected the activity of financial guarantee. Being someone‚Äôs guarantor is a financial act as well as a moral support. That‚Äôs why I decided to create Cautioneo, specialized in digital guarantee for the rental home market. Looking for a rental is a long journey and many people are rejected: youth, fixed-term contracts, freelancers, business owners, seniors, etc. The idea is to offer something that revolutionizes and simplifies the tenant‚Äôs journey, and it needs to be accessible to the majority of people. Innovation means offering useful services. Technology must be at the service of Man‚Äôs everyday needs.‚Äô‚Äô
Julien Chenet, co-founder of Cautioneo
¬©Vincent Colin
#Innovation #Web #HumanInside
caption: Photo by Orange in Lille, France with @cautioneo.

description:
¬´ En France, la recherche m√©dicale est tr√®s pointue. Mais quand il s‚Äôagit de recruter des volontaires pour des √©tudes, le parcours s‚Äôav√®re laborieux et chronophage. Pr√®s de 400 000 nouveaux cas de cancers sont d√©clar√©s chaque ann√©e. Beaucoup de ces malades mais aussi leur entourage sont susceptibles d‚Äô√™tre int√©ress√©s pour participer √† des √©tudes. J‚Äôai alors cr√©√© l‚Äôassociation Seintinelles apr√®s ma r√©mission d‚Äôun cancer du sein, avec le m√©decin qui m‚Äôa suivie. Cette plateforme collaborative met en relation chercheurs et volontaires pour participer √† des √©tudes. Elle se met au service de l‚Äôacc√©l√©ration de la recherche, donc des malades. La technologie doit nous rapprocher et nous aider √† cr√©er une soci√©t√© meilleure, √† devenir plus √©galitaires. Elle doit nous relier les uns aux autres. ¬ª
Guillemette Jacob, co-fondatrice de l‚Äôassociation Seintinelles
***
‚Äò‚ÄôIn France, medical research is very specialized. But when it comes to recruiting volunteers for studies, the journey is laborious and time-consuming. Nearly 400,000 new cases of cancer are reported each year. Many of these patients and their families and friends are likely to be interested in participating in studies. That‚Äôs why I created the Seintinelles association after my remission from breast cancer, with the doctor who followed me. This collaborative platform brings together researchers and volunteers in order for them to participate in studies. It is at the service of improving the speed of research, and therefore, it‚Äôs at the service of patients as well. Technology must bring us closer together and help us create a better society, and become more egalitarian. It must connect us all to each other.‚Äô‚Äô
Guillemette Jacob, co-founder of the Seintinelles association
¬©Vincent Colin
#ESant√© #TechForGood #Association #HumanInside
caption: Photo by Orange on December 03, 2019.

description:
‚Äò‚ÄôI identified a problem in the fishing industry. Fishermen were catching fish they shouldn't, including endangered species and juveniles, and throwing them back into the sea. This led to overfishing and arrests for illegally discarding fish. I decided to create selective fishing technology that is beneficial to the environment, and helps particular types of fish. SafetyNet makes it possible for fishermen to avoid catching the wrong fish in the first place, meaning they don't have to bring them onto the boat at all. Our Pisces devices are fitted onto the fishing nets and make fish stocks more sustainable. Technology allows us to solve real problems the world is facing. It does make the world a better place but the responsibility is ours. To me, innovation means applying experimental knowledge to help solve a problem at a larger scale.‚Äô‚Äô
Daniel Watson, CEO of SafetyNet
***

‚Äò‚ÄôI received the first prize of the 9th edition of the Orange Social Venture Prize in Africa and the Middle East. What a blessing! Benefiting from the Orange label, a group well established in Africa, will facilitate the development of my project.

‚Äò‚ÄôToday, there are 11 million family carers in France. Not all of them can be there in the evening or at night for their loved ones. description:
¬´¬†Etudiante, j‚Äôaimais d√©j√† l‚Äôid√©e de produire de l‚Äô√©nergie en harmonie avec l‚Äôenvironnement. Comment r√©cup√©rer l‚Äô√©nergie des fleuves avec des turbines ? description:
‚Äò‚ÄôI‚Äôve always been fascinated with cybernetics: how humans and machines can interface to make new experiences. Using a camera and some image processing, our glasses can detect objects and enhance certain features like the edges, or contrast or color, etc. to show them in a way which is tailored to your visual needs.The challenge is to enhance vision but make it into something that‚Äôs really elegant and people want to wear. So that they don‚Äôt feel self-conscious about having a disability. I want to empower people and have fun doing it.‚Äô‚Äô

***

description:
‚Äò‚ÄôMy vision is to create a litter-free world. It started on a walk in the woods, when my children noticed a plastic tub of cat litter lying in a creek. description:
¬´¬†Pr√®s de 5 millions de personnes ont un probl√®me d‚Äôusage d‚Äôalcool en France. Seuls 10% d‚Äôentre eux sont pris en charge m√©dicalement. Comment aider les 90% qui n‚Äôentrent pas dans le cadre de soins ou qui pensent que leur consommation n‚Äôest pas n√©faste ? Je suis convaincu que l‚Äôoutil num√©rique est une solution. J‚Äôai con√ßu l‚Äôapplication Myd√©fi en m‚Äôinspirant des techniques d‚Äôaccompagnement et de soutien existantes comme l‚Äôagenda de consommation, les th√©rapies cognitivo-comportementales, l‚Äôentretien motivationnel, la gestion des envies, etc.  Mon objectif est de retrouver le savoir-faire de la communaut√© des addictologues dans un outil num√©rique. ‚Äò‚ÄôIn France, about 5 million people have alcohol abuse problems. Only 10% of them are being medically treated. How can we help the remaining 90% that are not eligible for a medical care or think their alcohol consumption isn‚Äôt harmful? I‚Äôm convinced that digital technology is the solution. The aim is not to replace the medical staff but to offer an extra help. I created the Myd√©fi app, drawing from existing support and help approaches such as the drinking diary, cognitive behavioral therapies, the motivational interview, the management of cravings, etc. My goal is to gather the savoir-faire of the addictologists‚Äô community in a digital tool. The objective is to help all the people who want to reduce their alcohol consumption. Innovation means providing usefulness.‚Äô‚Äô

description:
¬´¬†A l‚Äôoccasion d‚Äôun concours organis√© sur le th√®me des √©nergies du futur, avec mon associ√©, j‚Äôai pu rencontrer des ONG qui op√®rent sur le terrain apr√®s des catastrophes climatiques. description:

description:

description:

description:

description:

***

description:
¬´¬†Chez Orange, je n‚Äôai pas de routine et cela favorise l‚Äôing√©niosit√©. Je travaille sur la virtualisation des r√©seaux. Lorsque des grandes entreprises comme les banques ou les soci√©t√©s d‚Äôassurance souhaitent s‚Äôinterconnecter ou se connecter √† Internet de mani√®re s√©curis√©e, elles utilisent de nombreuses machines sp√©cifiques qu‚Äôelles h√©bergent dans leurs locaux. Mon but est de remplacer leur imposant mat√©riel par du logiciel, donc de remplacer leurs infrastructures par celles propos√©es par Orange. Cela permet √† nos clients de faire des √©conomies de ressources, de gagner en flexibilit√© et en temps. Avant, √† chaque fois qu‚Äôils souhaitaient configurer leur r√©seau, ils demandaient l‚Äôintervention d‚Äôun technicien. Aujourd‚Äôhui, ils peuvent le faire de fa√ßon simplifi√©e, directement sur un portail web. La technologie doit √™tre un support et faciliter notre quotidien, sans remplacer l‚ÄôHumain.¬†¬ª
D√©borah Paquier, Ing√©nieur logiciel chez Orange
***
‚Äò‚ÄôWorking at Orange, I don‚Äôt have a daily routine and this is furthering my ingenuity. I‚Äôm working on the virtualization of networks. When big firms such as banks or insurance companies want to be interconnected or have a secure Internet connection, they use specific devices that they host in-house. My goal is to replace this massive hardware by software, that‚Äôs to say replacing their infrastructures by those provided by Orange. This allows our clients to save up on resources, to save time and gain flexibility. Before that, every time they wanted a network to be set up, they had to call a technician. Now, they can easily do it through a web portal. Technology has to support and make our everyday life easier, without taking the place of humans.‚Äô‚Äô

description:
¬´¬†En France, la menace est fluctuante. Mon projet Heropolis est n√© un mois apr√®s les attentats de Paris du 13 novembre 2015. Il permet aujourd‚Äôhui d‚Äôam√©liorer la cha√Æne de secours d‚Äôun point de vue s√ªret√©. Que ce soit face au terrorisme ou au niveau de la s√©curit√© des personnes, face √† une urgence m√©dicale par exemple. Je pense qu‚Äôil est essentiel de mieux pr√©parer l‚Äôarriv√©e des secours. La technologie peut nous aider √† gagner de pr√©cieuses minutes et √† sauver des vies. A mon sens, innover, c‚Äôest se remettre en cause, porter un regard curieux sur le monde et oser tester de nouvelles choses. Cela demande du courage. Mais le monde s‚Äôest construit gr√¢ce √† une succession de gens t√©m√©raires.¬†¬ª

***
‚Äò‚ÄôIn France, threat takes multiple forms. My project, Heropolis, was born a month after the terrorist attack of November 13th 2015 in Paris. Today, it helps secure the chain of rescue. But the world was built upon a series of risk-taking people.‚Äô‚Äô

description:
¬´¬†Innover, c‚Äôest √™tre en permanence √† l‚Äô√©coute du besoin social et local et √™tre pr√™ts √† inventer la bonne r√©ponse. J‚Äôai eu envie de mettre tous les outils de l‚Äô√©conomie classique au service d‚Äôun impact social et environnemental. J‚Äôai alors co-cr√©√© Baluchon avec des personnes anim√©es par la m√™me passion pour la cuisine et l‚Äôenvie d‚Äôagir pour l‚Äôint√©r√™t collectif. Baluchon permet de connecter le sujet d‚Äôalimentation responsable √† celui de l‚Äôinclusion sociale et professionnelle. Comment ? En recrutant des ch√¥meurs longue dur√©e, en les formant sur le terrain aux m√©tiers de la restauration et de la logistique. Depuis 2013, on a accueilli 200 personnes en parcours d‚Äôinsertion. Pour moi, l‚Äôinnovation sociale est l‚Äôavenir de l‚Äô√©conomie comme l‚Äôa √©t√© l‚Äôinnovation technologique.¬†¬ª

***
‚Äò‚ÄôInnovating means paying close attention to social and local needs, and being ready to invent the appropriate response. description:
¬´¬†Apr√®s avoir enqu√™t√© sur la fuite d‚Äôun album d‚Äô‚Ä™Eminem‚Ä¨ et celle du film Twilight sur Internet, je suis en quelque sorte devenu le garde du corps du tout-num√©rique √† Hollywood. Pourtant, la protection des donn√©es n‚Äôest pas la seule facette de mon m√©tier. La mani√®re dont la cybers√©curit√© est repr√©sent√©e me tient √† coeur. Je travaille sur des productions comme Savages, Snowden, Mr. Robot ou Nerve en tant que superviseur technique afin de peindre un portrait authentique de la cybers√©curit√©. Mon r√¥le est de sensibiliser et d‚Äô√©duquer sur ce sujet, mais pas au sens acad√©mique. La meilleure fa√ßon de le faire, c‚Äôest en divertissant !  La s√©curit√© est un mot effrayant. Nous devons donc penser davantage en termes de s√ªret√© : la rendre cool et en quelque sorte gamifier notre exp√©rience de la data. C‚Äôest pour √ßa que mon travail dans le 7√®me Art me passionne : c‚Äôest le plus grand levier de communication au monde.¬†¬ª

Ralph Echemendia, Consultant en Cybers√©curit√© √† Hollywood ‚ÄúThe Ethical Hacker‚Äù
***
‚ÄúWhen I was 15, a friend got me into ham radio, it was that that eventually got me into computers. Even later, a career that would lead to me investigating the online leak of an ‚Ä™Eminem‚Ä¨‚Äôs album and the film Twilight Breaking Dawn. I became the go-to guy in terms of cybersecurity in Hollywood but that wasn‚Äôt the only aspect of my job though. I really care about how hacking is portrayed and used in entertainment. If I can add value to the story that‚Äôs when I enjoy being involved. This is how I came to provide technical supervision on productions such as Savages, Snowden, Nerve and Mr.Robot. My focus is to bring awareness and educate but not in the conventional sense of going to school. The best way is to entertain! Security is something we tend to shy away from. So, we need to think more in terms of safety: make it cool, gamify our experience and translate our data in a way we can all understand and control. That‚Äôs why I‚Äôm so passionate about working with the Arts: it‚Äôs the greatest communicator in the world.‚Äù
Ralph Echemendia, Cybersecurity consultant in Hollywood ‚ÄúThe Ethical Hacker‚Äù
¬©Orange/Webedia/Sipa/J.Chou

#hollywood #cybersecurity #datasecurity #HumanInside
caption: Photo by Orange in Hollywood with @rechemendia.

description:
¬´¬†Dans le monde arabe, il y a peu de contenus ludiques attractifs pour sensibiliser les plus jeunes aux sujets environnementaux et sociaux. description:
¬´¬†Pour moi, innover c‚Äôest identifier un probl√®me qui existe pour une portion de la soci√©t√©, leur apporter la solution et rendre le tout viable d‚Äôun point de vue commercial. description:
¬´¬†Sans le digital, notre collectif de photographes n‚Äôaurait jamais exist√©. Au d√©but des ann√©es 2000, Lima a commenc√© √† se moderniser rapidement et on a voulu garder une trace de ce qui disparaissait. Avec l‚Äôapparition des appareils num√©riques grand public, c‚Äô√©tait facile et gratuit. C'√©tait la premi√®re fois que la vie de nos quartiers √©tait prise en photo de mani√®re syst√©matique. On exposait ensuite les images dans la rue sur des fils √† linge ou en les collant sur les murs. Les gens venaient nous voir en nous disant qu‚Äôils avaient reconnu leur cousin policier ou leur fr√®re marchand ambulant. Maintenant, tout le monde ou presque est capable de s‚Äôexprimer en photo ou en vid√©o gr√¢ce aux smartphones. C‚Äôest une r√©volution, dans un pays o√π l'illettrisme est monnaie courante. Avec les r√©seaux sociaux ces images sont relay√©es tr√®s rapidement. Tout un chacun peut montrer sa r√©alit√©, t√©moigner ou simplement dire qu‚Äôil existe, m√™me au fin fond de l‚ÄôAmazonie. On parle d‚Äôinclusion num√©rique, en r√©alit√© c‚Äôest de l‚Äôinclusion tout court.¬†¬ª

***
‚Äò‚ÄôWithout digital, our group of photographers would never have existed. In the early 2000s, Lima started quickly modernizing and we wanted to keep track of what was disappearing. With affordable digital cameras, it was easy and free. It was the first time that the life of our neighbourhoods was photographed in a systematic way. These images were then displayed in the street on clotheslines or glued to the walls. People came to us to tell us that they had recognized a policeman they knew or a fellow street vendor. Now, almost everyone is able to express themselves through photo or video thanks to smartphones. It's a revolution, in a country where illiteracy is commonplace. With social media, these images are relayed very quickly. Anyone can show their reality, express themselves or simply say that they exist, even from the depths of the Amazon. We talk about digital inclusion, but really, it‚Äôs quite simply just inclusion.‚Äô‚Äô
Tunchi, member of LimaFotoLibre photographer group.
¬©Orange/Webedia/Sipa/J. Orihuela
#photography #inclusionnumerique #HumanInside

description:
¬´¬†Je suis plus motiv√© par le progr√®s que l‚Äôinnovation qui n‚Äôest que l‚Äôintroduction dans la soci√©t√© de choses nouvelles, issues des techniques. Aujourd‚Äôhui, la soci√©t√© est inqui√®te des applications des nouvelles technologies. A l‚ÄôAcad√©mie des Technologies, on se pr√©occupe de leur utilit√© sociale : am√©liorent-elles la vie des gens¬†? ¬´¬†La tech¬†¬ª est omnipr√©sente dans les discours comme un objectif en soi. C‚Äôest une p√©riode un peu ¬´¬†techno-chiante¬ª .¬† Il faut partir des attentes, souhaits et d√©sirs de la soci√©t√©, et choisir les technologies √† mettre en ≈ìuvre pour y r√©pondre. Il y a un mouvement fort qui balaie la plan√®te : ¬´ Innovation for a better life ¬ª, parti de Shanghai lors de l‚Äôexposition universelle de 2010. La technologie est ¬´¬†un outil au service de l‚Äôam√©lioration de la condition humaine¬†¬ª nous disent les philosophes de la Renaissance.¬†¬ª
Marc Giget, Pr√©sident du Club de Paris des Directeurs de l‚ÄôInnovation‚Ä®Paris
***
‚Äò‚ÄôI‚Äôm more motivated by progress than innovation because the latter is just the mere bringing of new things ‚Äì coming from technical development ‚Äì into society. Nowadays, people get worried about the practical applications of new technologies. Here at the Academy of Technologies, we are concerned about their social usefulness: do they improve people‚Äôs life? Everyone is talking about ‚Äútech‚Äù all the time as if it was an end in itself. We‚Äôre living in rather ‚Äútechno-boring‚Äù times. We must consider the expectations, the needs and the wishes of our society, and choose the according technologies to satisfy them. There‚Äôs a strong movement taking shape around the globe called ‚ÄúInnovation for a better life ‚Äú that was born during the 2010 World Exhibition in Shanghai. Renaissance philosophers once said that technology is ‚Äúa tool in the service of improving human condition‚Äù.‚Äô‚Äô‚Ä®Marc Giget, President of the Paris Club of Directors in Innovation
¬©Vincent Colin

description:
¬´¬†Du jour au lendemain, √† 29 ans, je suis devenue proche d‚Äôun patient qui souffre. Entre les traitements m√©dicamenteux lourds, les mois d‚Äôhospitalisation et d‚Äôisolement, je me suis demand√© que faire pour am√©liorer le quotidien hospitalier de mon compagnon. J‚Äôai vu le film Avatar, et cela a √©t√© un d√©clencheur : il fallait que je cr√©e un monde virtuel dans lequel les patients pourraient ‚Äú s‚Äô√©vader ‚Äù de leur chambre et de leurs traitements. Bliss est alors n√© apr√®s 9 ans de recherche et d√©veloppement. Cette solution de r√©alit√© virtuelle, v√©ritable dispositif m√©dical, am√©liore la qualit√© de vie et le confort du patient, r√©duit les consommations m√©dicamenteuses et le traumatisme li√© aux actes m√©dicaux lourds. La technologie doit √™tre pens√©e pour l‚Äôhumain. Mon objectif est que tous les patients aient la chance d‚Äôen b√©n√©ficier en France et ailleurs. La souffrance physique et psychique est partout.¬†¬ª
M√©lanie P√©ron, directrice de l‚ÄôEffet Papillon
***
‚Äò‚ÄôFrom one day to the next, at age 29, I suddenly became close to a patient in pain. Between heavy medical treatments, and months on end of hospitalization and isolation, I was wondering what I could do to improve my partner‚Äôs everyday life. Technology must be thought for humans. My goal is that all the patients have access to it in France and anywhere else. Physical and psychological pain is everywhere.‚Äô‚Äô

¬©Orange/Webedia/Sipa/F.Pieau

description:
¬´¬†J‚Äôai une vision sacralis√©e de l‚Äôinnovation. Pour moi, elle n‚Äôest pas uniquement une adaptation. Elle porte une part essentielle de cr√©ativit√©. La v√©ritable innovation se distingue d‚Äôun processus d‚Äôoptimisation et doit s‚Äôinscrire dans la rupture. J‚Äôai cr√©√© Ufeel, un v√©lo 100% √©lectrique, sans transmission m√©canique. Il est doublement innovant : technologiquement d‚Äôabord gr√¢ce √† l‚Äôutilisation des supercondensateurs en guise de batterie. Mais aussi par rapport √† l‚Äôusage : le cycliste va toujours p√©daler dans sa zone de confort, √† la vitesse et au niveau d‚Äôeffort souhait√©s. L‚Äôid√©e ici est que l‚Äôutilisateur p√©dale comme il respire, sans s‚Äôen rendre compte. Le progr√®s technologique apporte in√©vitablement un b√©n√©fice √† la soci√©t√©. C‚Äôest ensuite √† cette derni√®re de se l‚Äôapproprier pleinement afin d‚Äôen garantir un d√©veloppement harmonieux.¬†¬ª
Adrien Leli√®vre, CEO de Veloci Industries
***
‚Äò‚ÄôI have a sanctified vision of innovation. In my opinion, it is not only an adaptation. It holds an essential part of creativity. True innovation must be differentiated from an optimization process and must fit in with rupture. I created Ufeel, a 100% electric bicycle with no mechanical transmission. It is twice the innovation: on one hand, a technical one with the use of super-capacitors by way of battery. On the other, cyclists will always pedal within their comfort zone; at the desired speed and according to the level of effort they want. The idea is for the user to pedal the same way they breathe, without even noticing it. Technological progress is inevitably beneficial to society. However, the latter needs to fully get to grips with it in order to assure a harmonious development.‚Äô‚Äô
Adrien Leli√®vre, CEO of Veloci Industries
#innovation #tourdefrance #bike #HumanInside

description:
¬´¬†Dans ma sp√©cialit√©, l‚Äôintelligence artificielle s‚Äôassocie √† l‚Äôimagerie m√©dicale. Aujourd‚Äôhui, il y a un ph√©nom√®ne de routine : int√©grer beaucoup d‚Äôimageries n√©cessite de disposer d‚Äôun service informatique suffisamment efficace pour stocker les donn√©es massives. L‚Äôintelligence artificielle est b√©n√©fique aussi bien pour le patient que pour le m√©decin. Je consid√®re l‚Äôintelligence artificielle comme une aide essentielle pour le diagnostic et le suivi du patient. Ce n‚Äôest pas une menace. Pour moi, l‚Äôinnovation en sant√© va de pair avec une m√©decine personnalis√©e. Tous les jours, il y a une innovation en m√©decine. ***
‚Äò‚ÄôIn my field, artificial intelligence is helping medical imaging. Nowadays, in order to stock massive data of medical imaging, we need an efficient computer department. Artificial intelligence is as beneficial to patients as to doctors. Today, some specialized professionals ‚Äì especially in radiology ‚Äì fear being replaced. I consider artificial intelligence to be of essential help for diagnosing and monitoring patients. It‚Äôs not a threat anymore. In my opinion, health innovation is congruent with personalized medicine. I see it as a panel of new biological technologies for patients to get better and have a better quality of life.‚Äô‚Äô

description:
¬´¬†J‚Äôai mis fin √† une carri√®re de plus de 20 ans dans le marketing, motiv√©e par l‚Äôenvie d‚Äôun projet social. J‚Äôai quitt√© tout ce qui me rattachait au monde de la (sur)consommation pour me tourner vers un univers d‚Äô√©change, d‚Äô√©coute, d'entraide et de bienveillance. J‚Äôai voulu faire du b√©n√©volat mais je me suis vite rendue compte qu‚Äôil n‚Äôy avait pas de sites pratiques pour rendre service aux autres. Et qu‚Äôen plus, je manquais de temps. Avec mon associ√©, j‚Äôai donc cr√©√© WELP, une plateforme qui met en relation des b√©n√©voles anim√©s de bonne volont√© et des personnes en situation d‚Äôisolement, qui ont besoin d‚Äôaide ou de services. description:
¬´¬†Les chiffres du gaspillage alimentaire sont ahurissants : 10 millions de tonnes d‚Äôaliments consommables partent √† la poubelle chaque ann√©e en France, soit 18 milliards de repas. Autre bilan d√©sastreux, 5 √† 8 millions de personnes ne mangent pas √† leur faim. Partant de ce constat, j‚Äôai cr√©√© Linkee, une application qui donne √† chacun l‚Äôopportunit√© d‚Äô√™tre acteur de la solidarit√©, o√π il veut et quand il veut. Les restaurateurs, traiteurs, supermarch√©s, cantines collectives peuvent mettre √† disposition leurs invendus dans un cadre s√©curis√©, agr√©√© par l‚ÄôEtat. Tout le monde y gagne¬†! La force des syst√®mes collaboratifs associ√©s aux nouvelles technologies est de mettre √† profit notre connexion permanente pour accro√Ætre la solidarit√© et diminuer l‚Äôempreinte carbone. Dans l‚Äôid√©e que je me fais d‚Äôun monde id√©al, comme pour les Restos du c≈ìur au d√©but, Linkee n‚Äôexisterait pas.¬†¬ª

description:

description:

description:

description:

description:

description:

L‚Äôapplication Staying Alive permet de cartographier les d√©fibrillateurs et de sauver des vies. Les Bons Samaritains, form√©s aux gestes de premiers secours, re√ßoivent sur leur mobile une notification des services de secours et peuvent ainsi rapidement venir en aide aux victimes d‚Äôarr√™t cardiaque. Il y a 25 ans naissait Internet, une des plus grandes innovations de l‚Äôhumanit√© selon moi. J‚Äôai assist√© √† l‚Äô√©closion d‚Äôun monde nouveau : ce r√©seau permet de mettre en contact les humains entre eux de fa√ßon extr√™mement simple et rapide. L‚Äôinventivit√© des hommes et les technologies d√©velopp√©es doivent am√©liorer notre vie.¬†¬ª
Laurent Istria, Responsable du d√©veloppement du Bon Samaritain pour la France
***
‚Äò‚ÄôDuring a heart attack, the first minutes are crucial. In order to save a victim, two fundamental actions must be taken: heart massage and defibrillation. There are about 50 000 cardiac arrests in France every year. The survival rate is low, only 7% of the victims recover without serious sequelae. Staying Alive is an application that locates defibrillators on a map and helps saving lives. Good Samaritans ‚Äì people trained in first aid techniques ‚Äì get a notification on their mobile phone from emergency services and are quickly able to come to the rescue of heart stroke victims. 25 years ago, the Internet was born and, in my opinion, it‚Äôs one of the greatest inventions of mankind. I've seen the blooming of a new world: this network is able to keep human beings in touch in an extremely quick and simple fashion. The inventiveness of mankind and its developing technologies must make our lives better.‚Äô‚Äô
Laurent Istria, Head of the Good Samaritan's development for France.
¬©Vincent Colin
#Tech4Good #App #FrenchTech #HumanInside

description:
¬´¬†Depuis mon plus jeune √¢ge, ma tablette et mon portable m‚Äôaccompagnent au quotidien. Handicap√© moteur de naissance, ma m√®re me tenait mon t√©l√©phone pour que je m‚Äôen serve. A l‚Äôadolescence, j‚Äôai voulu √™tre autonome. J‚Äôai donc cr√©√© un bras articul√© dot√© d‚Äôune grande amplitude, parce que j‚Äôutilise mon nez pour taper sur les touches. J‚Äôai tout de suite voulu le commercialiser pour aider les personnes dans la m√™me situation que moi. J‚Äôai alors cr√©√© Handieasy, un site de vente en ligne. La technologie me rend heureux. J‚Äôaime l‚Äôid√©e de la mettre √† profit d‚Äôautres handicap√©s, comme moi. Au salon VivaTech, je suis ravi de partager le stand Orange avec des √©tudiantes tunisiennes, cr√©atrices de MooVoBrain, une solution adapt√©e aux besoins des personnes √† mobilit√© r√©duite. J‚Äôattends beaucoup du d√©veloppement de l‚Äôintelligence artificielle pour faciliter notre quotidien.¬†¬ª

‚Äò‚ÄôSince an early age, my tablet and my cellphone have accompanied me in my everyday life. Physically disabled since I was born, my mother was holding my phone so that I could use it. When I grew up to become a teenager, I wanted to be autonomous. So I conceived an artificial arm that has a great range because I use my nose to type on the keyboard. I‚Äôve immediately wanted to make it available on the market with the aim of helping people in my situation. Then I created Handieasy, an online shopping website. Technology makes me happy. I like the idea of making it available for other disabled persons like me. At the VivaTech fair, I‚Äôm thrilled to share the Orange stand with the Tunisian students that created MooVoBrain which is a solution designed for people with reduced mobility. I have high hopes in the developing of artificial intelligence in order to make our everyday life better.‚Äô‚Äô
Jason Chemama, creator of Handieasy

description:
¬´¬†Un milliard de personnes n‚Äôont pas acc√®s √† l‚Äô√©lectricit√©. 600 millions d‚Äôentre elles se trouvent en Afrique subsaharienne. Aujourd‚Äôhui, ces populations s‚Äô√©clairent avec des lampes √† k√©ros√®ne, extr√™mement polluantes et toxiques. La batterie hiLyte que j‚Äôai d√©velopp√©e avec mes associ√©s se recharge √† l‚Äôaide de consommables au fer que l‚Äôon y ins√®re. Et permet de g√©n√©rer suffisamment d‚Äô√©nergie pour allumer une lampe, donc √©clairer un foyer, ou charger un t√©l√©phone portable. Ce sont les deux besoins d‚Äô√©nergie principaux dans les pays √©mergents. Notre batterie peut √™tre manipul√©e en toute s√©curit√©, sans risque au niveau de la sant√©, et sans impact n√©gatif du point de vue √©cologique. J‚Äôestime que la technologie doit rendre service en tenant compte de l‚Äôenvironnement naturel et soci√©tal dans lequel on l‚Äôutilise. L‚Äôinnovation prend vraiment tout son sens lorsqu‚Äôelle r√©sout les besoins fondamentaux.¬†¬ª
Jonathan Fiorentini, co-fondateur de hiLyte
***
‚Äò‚ÄôOne billion people do not have access to electricity. 600 million of them are in sub-Saharan Africa. Today, these populations still use kerosene lamps, which are extremely polluting and toxic. The hiLyte iron battery I've developed with my partners is charged with iron parts. This generates enough energy to light a lamp, and it‚Äôs also capable of lighting a fireplace and charging a mobile phone. These are the two main energy needs in emerging countries. Our battery can be handled safely, without risking people‚Äôs health, and without any negative ecological impact. I believe that technology must be useful, taking into account the natural and societal environment in which it is used. Innovation makes more sense when it solves basic needs.‚Äô‚Äô Jonathan Fiorentini, co-founder of hiLyte

description:
¬´¬†J‚Äôai fond√© Ecosia il y a 9 ans. J‚Äôai v√©cu 6 mois au N√©pal, un des pays les plus pauvres du monde et pr√®s d‚Äôun an en Am√©rique du Sud. Depuis ces deux endroits, j‚Äôai pris conscience de l‚Äôampleur des d√©g√¢ts caus√©s sur l‚Äôenvironnement. J‚Äôai voulu agir en utilisant la technologie. Je me suis dit ‚Äú Pourquoi ne pas proposer un moteur de recherche qui aide √† la fois les gens et la plan√®te, en plantant des arbres ? ‚Äù. Depuis les d√©buts d‚ÄôEcosia, 53 millions d‚Äôarbres ont √©t√© plant√©s, √† raison d‚Äôun par seconde. En √©liminant le CO2 de l‚Äôatmosph√®re, nous luttons contre le changement climatique, donc c‚Äôest b√©n√©fique pour tout le monde. Je veux vivre dans un monde o√π chacun profite d‚Äôune belle vie sur une plan√®te en bonne sant√©, et o√π les gens s‚Äôimpliquent de fa√ßon significative.¬†¬ª
Christian Kroll, CEO d‚ÄôEcosia
***
‚Äò‚ÄôI started Ecosia 9 years ago. I‚Äôve spent half a year living in Nepal, which is one of the poorest countries in the world and also more than half a year in South America. From both places, I basically observed how much we are destroying the planet. So I wanted to do something with technology. I thought ‚ÄúLet‚Äôs do a search engine that helps the people and the planet, and the best way to do that at the same time is by planting trees‚Äù. We‚Äôve planted 53 million trees by now - we‚Äôre heading 1 tree every second. That takes CO2 out of the atmosphere, which means we are fighting climate change, so it‚Äôs beneficial for everyone.I want to live in a world where everybody is having a good life, where we have a healthy planet and people do meaningful things and I think everybody should want that.‚Äô‚Äô

description:
¬´¬†Avec Goodeed, j‚Äôai voulu r√©inventer le concept de l‚Äôentreprise. J‚Äôai cr√©√© ma start-up √† 17 ans, inspir√© par un livre de Muhammad Yunus, √©conomiste bangladais et prix Nobel de la paix. Il est aussi l‚Äôinventeur du concept du microcr√©dit et de l‚Äôentreprise sociale. L‚Äôid√©e de Goodeed m‚Äôest venue √† No√´l, p√©riode de forte exposition pour les marques et pour les associations. En voyant ces deux mondes se confronter, j‚Äôai voulu b√¢tir un pont entre les deux et permettre aux gens de faire des dons gratuitement en regardant une vid√©o publicitaire sur Internet. Goodeed finance tout type de projets et en a d√©j√† soutenu plus de 150, li√©s √† l‚Äôenvironnement, √† l‚Äô√©ducation et √† la r√©insertion professionnelle. Innover n‚Äôest pas juste cr√©er un √©ni√®me outil technologique. Je consid√®re que le progr√®s est social. Il doit avoir un impact sur le monde et un sens collectif.¬†¬ª
Vincent Touboul-Flachaire, fondateur de Goodeed
***
‚Äò‚ÄôWith Goodeed, I wanted to reinvent the concept of the company. I've started my startup at age 17, inspired by a book by Muhammad Yunus, a Bangladeshi economist and Nobel Peace Prize winner. He is also the inventor of both microcredit concept and social enterprise. The idea of Goodeed came to me at Christmas, a time of great exposure for brands and associations. Seeing these two separate worlds, I wanted to create a link between the two and allow people to make free donations by watching an Internet video ad. Goodeed finances all types of projects and has already supported more than 150 associations related to the environment, education and professional reintegration. Innovation is not just about creating the next technological tool. For me, progress is something social. It must not only have an impact on the world, but also have a collective sense.‚Äô‚Äô
Vincent Touboul-Flachaire, founder of Goodeed‚Ä®¬©Vincent Colin
#StartUp #FrenchTech #HumanInside

description:
¬´¬†A mon sens, l‚Äôinnovation associe analyse des tendances et volont√© de proposer un service ou un produit diff√©rent de ce qui existe √† un temps donn√©. En co-fondant WeMoms avec mon associ√©, j'ai fait le constat d‚Äôun changement de rapport √† l‚Äôinformation de la nouvelle g√©n√©ration de parents et d‚Äôune offre (blogs, forums, magazines‚Ä¶) qui pouvait √™tre revisit√©e pour offrir un service adapt√© aux nouvelles attentes.¬† Le concept d‚Äôentre-aide, d‚Äô√©change, de r√©assurance, et l‚Äôeffet ¬´ feel good ¬ª sont essentiels. Je vois la p√©riode que nous vivons comme une √©tape majeure de la relations qu‚Äôentretient l‚Äôhomme avec le traitement de l‚Äôinformation. Apr√®s l‚Äô√©criture, l‚Äôimprimerie, c‚Äôest maintenant Internet qui bouleverse nos √©changes, modes de consommation, relations‚Ä¶ parfois inqui√©tant et toujours passionnant !¬†¬ª
Dino Jaegle, co-fondateur de WeMoms
***
‚Äò‚ÄôIn my opinion, innovation combines trend analysis and the desire to offer a different service or product at a given time. By co-founding WeMoms with my partner, I've noticed a change in the information for the new generation of parents and offers (blogs, forums, magazines ...) that could impact a service adapted to new expectations. The concept of mutual aid, exchange, reinsurance, and the "feel good" effect are essential. I see the period we are living in as a major step in our relationship with information processing. After writing and printing, now the Internet is what disrupts our exchanges, consumption patterns, relationships... Sometimes disturbing and always exciting!‚Äô‚Äô
Dino Jaegle, co-founder of WeMoms‚Ä®¬©Vincent Colin
#Innovation #FrenchTech #StartUp #Internet #HumanInside

description:
¬´¬†Pour avoir un impact sur la qualit√© des produits de demain, il faut travailler avec les acteurs de l‚Äôindustrie agroalimentaire qui produisent √† grande √©chelle.¬† En cr√©ant ScanUp, je suis partie d‚Äôune question simple¬†: ¬´¬†Que faire pour que les produits de grande consommation vendus en supermarch√© soient de meilleure qualit√©¬†?¬†¬ª. Avec mes associ√©s, j‚Äôai donc d√©velopp√© une application mobile gratuite permettant aux industriels de d√©poser un projet de co-cr√©ation via l‚Äôapplication. Et aux consommateurs de voter pour les caract√©ristiques des futurs produits. Cela peut √™tre leur mode de production, l‚Äôorigine des mati√®res premi√®res, leur composition, etc. L‚Äôid√©e est de b√¢tir une communaut√© engag√©e autour de l‚Äôalimentation pour r√©pondre √† sa d√©fiance sur le sujet. ScanUp¬† s‚Äôappuie sur des comit√©s scientifiques externes pour √©valuer la qualit√© des produits. L‚Äôinnovation est forc√©ment collaborative et doit avoir un impact positif sur la soci√©t√©, sinon elle n‚Äôa pas de sens.¬†¬ª
Caroline P√©chery, co-fondatrice de ScanUp
***
‚Äò‚ÄôTo have an impact on the quality of tomorrow's products, we must work with players of the agri-food industry who produce on a large scale. In creating ScanUp, I‚Äôve started from a simple question: "What can be done to improve the quality of consumer products sold in supermarkets?". I've developed with my partners a free mobile application that allows manufacturers to submit a co-creation project via the application - and consumers can vote for the future products‚Äô features. This can be their production method, the origin of the raw materials, their composition, etc. The idea is to build a committed community around food to respond to its mistrust on the subject. ScanUp relies on external scientific committees to evaluate product quality. Innovation must be collaborative and should have a positive impact on society, otherwise it makes no sense.‚Äô‚Äô
Caroline P√©chery, co-founder of ScanUp‚Ä®¬©Vincent Colin‚Ä®#Innovation #StartUp #FrenchTech #HumanInside

description:
¬´¬†Ma fille ne se brossait pas trop les dents, et c‚Äô√©tait compliqu√© de savoir si elle l‚Äôavait vraiment fait. En revanche, elle n‚Äôa jamais eu aucun probl√®me pour jouer sur mon t√©l√©phone !¬† C‚Äôest ce qui m‚Äôa donn√© l‚Äôid√©e de Kolibree : une brosse √† dents connect√©e con√ßue pour transformer l‚Äôexp√©rience p√©nible du brossage en un jeu. Nos brosses √† dents sont √©quip√©es de capteurs qui mesurent les mouvements. Via le t√©l√©phone, on profite ensuite d‚Äôun coaching en temps r√©el ludique pour am√©liorer la qualit√© du brossage. C‚Äôest une exp√©rience compl√®te, qui s‚Äôadresse √† tout le monde. Gr√¢ce √† l‚Äô√©lectronique et au machine learning, on favorise un changement de comportement qui aide √† lutter contre les caries ‚Äî qui touchent 92% des Fran√ßais. Depuis la pr√©sentation de notre premi√®re brosse √† dents connect√©e au CES en 2014, nous avons boucl√© une campagne de financement participatif, sign√© un partenariat avec Colgate et sommes disponibles dans les Apple stores. Aujourd‚Äôhui nous sommes pr√©sents partout dans le monde.¬†¬ª

***
‚Äò‚ÄôMy daughter did not like brushing her teeth much. As a parent, I had a hard time checking whether she did it properly or not. She was much less reluctant however to play on my phone! This is how Kolibree was born. The idea was to develop a connected toothbrush to transform such an unpleasant experience into a game. Our toothbrushes have motion sensors. With the help of a smartphone, users get fun coaching in real time to make teeth brushing more efficient. The experience is complete and designed for all. Since we unveiled our first smart toothbrush at the 2014 CES, we have successfully completed a crowdfunding campaign, signed a partnership with Colgate and are available in Apple stores. We are now available worldwide.‚Äô‚Äô

description:
¬´¬†Quand j‚Äô√©tais jeune, ma m√®re √©tait sans arr√™t √† d√©couvert. C‚Äôest tr√®s pesant comme situation. En me penchant sur la question de l‚Äô√©pargne, je me suis rendu compte que le livret A n‚Äôa pas √©volu√© depuis sa cr√©ation il y a 200 ans. Et pourtant, il y a plein d‚Äôaspects √† moderniser : la mani√®re de l‚Äôalimenter, la gestion, le rendement‚Ä¶ Aujourd‚Äôhui, 11 millions de Fran√ßais √©pargnent peu, ou pas du tout. On pense qu‚Äôil est possible de les aider avec un autre syst√®me, innovant, ludique et indolore. Yeeld a imagin√© plusieurs m√©thodes pour simplifier et automatiser l‚Äô√©pargne en la rendant plus amusante. L‚Äôarrondi √† l‚Äôeuro sup√©rieur des d√©penses CB permet de mettre de l‚Äôargent de c√¥t√© sans s‚Äôen rendre compte. Un autre exemple : avec la r√®gle 52 - 1 euro la premi√®re semaine, 2 euros la deuxi√®me‚Ä¶ jusqu‚Äô√† 52 euros la 52√®me semaine, on apprend √† √©pargner progressivement 1378 euros sur l‚Äôann√©e. Yeeld propose aussi des rendements plus √©lev√©s : 4% via notre partenariat avec Amazon. Bref, il y a mille et une nouvelles fa√ßons d‚Äô√©pargner gr√¢ce au digital !¬†¬ª
***
"When I was young, my mother was constantly having money issues. It was a very difficult situation. When I look at the savings problem, I have realized that savings account has not evolved since its inception 200 years ago. And yet, there are many aspects to improve: deposits, management, performance... Today, 11 million French save little or nothing at all. We think it is possible to help them with an innovative, playful and painless system. Yeeld has come up with several methods to simplify and automate savings by making it more fun. The rounding up of debit card expenses to the next euro makes it possible to set money aside without realizing it. Another example: with the 52-week Money Challenge - ‚Ç¨1 the first week, ‚Ç¨2 the second‚Ä¶ until ‚Ç¨52 the 52nd week - we learn to save gradually ‚Ç¨1,378 over a year. The rounding up of debit card expenses to the next euro makes it possible to set money aside without realizing it. Yeeld also offers higher returns: 4% via our partnership with Amazon. In a nutshell, there are a million new ways to save money with a little help from digital!"
Nagib Beydoun, CEO of Yeeld

description:
¬´¬†Quand je suis sur les toits avec les ruches, je me sens tellement bien. C‚Äôest une opportunit√© pour d√©connecter. Avec l‚Äôinitiative ¬´¬†Orange Let it Bee¬†¬ª, je rev√™ts la casquette d‚Äôapiculteur √† mes heures perdues, tous les 15 jours, au printemps et en √©t√©. Je vois ce projet comme une coupure bienvenue face √† la technologie. De plus, sans la pollinisation par les abeilles, les pertes indirectes et √† long terme seraient √©normes. Un tiers des aliments que nous consommons sont tributaires des abeilles. Ainsi, j‚Äôestime faire ma part pour pr√©server les abeilles et prot√©ger les ruches de la pollution.
Le financement d‚ÄôOrange a √©t√© utile pour s‚Äô√©quiper et √™tre form√©. J‚Äôai appris avec des plus anciens et maintenant c‚Äôest √† mon tour de transmettre aux nouveaux apiculteurs. Aujourd‚Äôhui, on ne compte pas moins de 60 ruches et une bonne centaine d‚Äôapiculteurs Orange. Le miel alors produit est vendu pour r√©colter des fonds pour venir en aide √† des association.¬†¬ª
Didier Poupard, Apiculteur du programme ¬´ Let It Bee ¬ª
***
‚Äò‚ÄôI feel really good when I'm on the rooftop with ‚Ä™the hives‚Ä¨. This is an opportunity to disconnect. With the "Orange Let it Bee" initiative, I can wear a beekeeper hat in my spare time every fortnight for spring and summer. I see this project as a welcome break from technology. In addition, without pollination by bees, indirect and long-term losses would be enormous. One third of the food we eat is dependent on them. So I feel I am doing my part to protect bees and hives from pollution.
Orange's funding has been useful in equipping and training. I've learned from older beekeepers and now it's my turn to pass on to new ones.
Today there are at least 60 hives and hundreds of Orange beekeepers. The honey produced is sold to raise funds to help associations.‚Äô‚Äô
Didier Poupard, ‚ÄúLet It Bee‚Äù Beekeeper
¬©Vincent Colin
üêù#Bee #Honey #LetItBee #LifeAtOrange #HumanInside

description:

Hors-cadre, ils tiennent la banderole de la Voix des sans-papiers. Le portable est l‚Äôinstrument de leur dignit√©, le moyen de rester en lien avec ceux rest√©s ¬´ l√†-bas ¬ª. ***

description:
Je suis le fondateur d‚ÄôAntidox. Dans le cadre de mon activit√©, j‚Äôaccompagne des dirigeants europ√©ens et mondiaux dans leur strat√©gie de communication. L‚Äôun de leurs principaux enjeux aujourd‚Äôhui est de se forger une vision du monde tel qu‚Äôil est. Orange Institute me permet de me d√©placer dans les diff√©rents √©picentres de la Tech mondiale, et d‚Äôen analyser les principaux m√©canismes en rencontrant les acteurs de leurs sc√®nes technologiques, et plus largement ceux qui pensent leurs politiques d‚Äôinnovation. Les innovations sont fondamentalement des r√©ponses √† des besoins sp√©cifiques. Elles constituent des solutions en termes d‚Äôusage avant d‚Äô√™tre des inventions technologiques. La diversit√© et le niveau des d√©cideurs pr√©sents √† l‚ÄôOrange Institute permettent de croiser les regards, de penser de fa√ßon collective, secteur par secteur, pour d√©gager les solutions technologiques qui peuvent apporter des b√©n√©fices aux diff√©rentes populations.
Xavier Desmaison, CEO d‚ÄôAntidox et membre d‚ÄôOrange Institute
***
I am the founder of Antidox. Part of my job is to support European and world leaders in their communication strategy. One of their main challenges today is to forge a vision of the world as it is. Orange Institute allows me to travel to the different technological poles around the world, and to analyze their main mechanisms by not only meeting the people behind technological scenes, but also those thinking innovation policies. Innovations are basically responses to specific needs. They are solutions in terms of use before being technological inventions. Both diversity and level of the decision-makers at the Orange Institute make it possible to compare views, to think collectively, sector by sector, and to identify technological solutions which can bring benefits to different groups.
Xavier Desmaison, CEO of Antidox and member of Orange Institute

description:
¬´¬†Super Codeur, c‚Äôest avant tout de l‚Äôinnovation sociale. Au-del√† de la transmission, j‚Äôai envie de d√©velopper leur go√ªt pour le num√©rique. Ainsi, ces jeunes ne seront pas seulement consommateurs de jeux vid√©o mais des cr√©ateurs.
Dans le cadre de ce programme, j‚Äôaccueille aussi, avec mes coll√®gues coachs, des stagiaires de classe de 3√®me issus de zones d‚Äô√©ducation prioritaire. J‚Äôesp√®re faire na√Ætre chez eux des vocations.
Dans les op√©rations que je m√®ne, je forme √©galement les coll√©giens √† devenir des coachs juniors, pour qu‚Äôils transmettent √† leur tour, avec notre aide, leurs savoirs aupr√®s des plus jeunes du coll√®ge. Gr√©goire Khatchadourian, Responsable du d√©veloppement externe chez Orange‚Ä®***
‚Äò‚ÄôSuper Codeur is above all social innovation. Created 4 years ago at Orange, this movement has already trained 30,000 French and foreign children on basics coding and robotics. description:

‚Äò‚ÄôThis image makes me think of a metaphor, brought together by the graphic elements of the photo. The bricks, the blind, the window, the air conditioning ‚Äì they all represent technology, which plays an important and logical part in our daily lives, with an almost predictable simplicity.

description:
¬´¬†En tant qu'ing√©nieur, mon r√™ve est qu‚Äôun jour un mus√©e me commande des robots pour animer leurs expositions. J'√©tais dans une exposition d'instruments de musique et on ne pouvait pas les voir jouer. Je me suis alors dit qu‚Äôil fallait cr√©er un outil qui leur redonne vie. Les nouvelles technologies, je les d√©couvre toujours avec des grands yeux. Je suis convaincue que la technologie doit √™tre mise au service de l‚Äôhumain et cela peut aussi se faire d‚Äôune mani√®re ludique. ***
‚Äò‚ÄôAs an engineer, my dream is that one day a museum will ask me to create robots for their exhibitions. description:
Comment lutter contre le d√©clin d√©mocratique dans la soci√©t√© occidentale ? Nous avons besoin de recr√©er du lien entre les gens et leur environnement, ind√©pendamment des pouvoirs publics. Il faut maximiser leur engagement, pour r√©armer notre d√©mocratie repr√©sentative. Montrer que la mobilisation collective am√®ne une transformation positive de la soci√©t√©. Le digital nous a permis de construire une plateforme d√©di√©e √† cet engagement. Elle passe par des questions ouvertes, pos√©es √† des milliers de personnes, dans toutes les langues. √áa permet de s‚Äôimpliquer dans un sujet progressivement, sans √™tre un expert. Nous utilisons le digital pour qu‚Äôil joue un r√¥le de rem√©diation : on reconstruit l‚Äôintelligence collective entre les citoyens et les institutions. L‚Äôann√©e derni√®re, nous avons par exemple port√© l‚Äô√©laboration d‚Äôun plan d‚Äôaction concret visant √† r√©duire en trois ans les violences faites aux femmes. Notre souhait est de devenir l‚Äô√©cosyst√®me para d√©mocratique d‚Äôexpression citoyenne : LE lieu o√π les groupes se construisent et interf√®rent de mani√®re d√©mocratique avec le monde.
Axel Dauchez, fondateur de Make.org
***
How to respond to the decline of democracy in western societies? We need to create social bonds yet again between people and their environment apart from public authorities. We must enhance citizen participation to make representative democracy stronger and show that a broader, collective involvement leads to transformative, positive changes within society. Digital technologies gave us the tools to develop a dedicated platform able to ask open questions to thousands of individuals in all languages. This way, responders can become more involved in a given conversation even if they are not experts. Here, technology plays a role of remediation: we rebuild collective intelligence between citizens and institutions. Last year, for instance, we put forward a concrete plan aimed at reducing violence against women in a 3 years period. We aspire to become a para-democratic ecosystem based on civic participation. A place where all groups grow and interact with the outside world in a democratic way.
Axel Dauchez, founder of Make.org
¬©Vincent Colin
#HumanInside
caption: Photo shared by Orange on April 02, 2019 tagging @axeldauchez.

description:
¬´¬†Je ne sais pas si tous finiront par aller entretenir leurs ruches et leurs abeilles au fond du jardin. Je ne sais pas non plus si le miel sera bon, cr√©meux et floral.
Je sais juste que ces personnes, l√†, en tenues d‚Äôastronautes, plant√©es au milieu de leur tour et de leur bureau voisin, sont en mouvement. Ils se sensibilisent √† d"autres probl√©matiques, s'ouvrent √† d'autres sph√®res.
Nous sommes tous des acteurs du monde dans lequel nous vivons. √Ä nous de le rendre meilleur. Alors, Let's go ! Avant que √ßa ne pique vraiment.¬†¬ª
***
‚Äò‚ÄôI don‚Äôt know if they will all finish by going and looking after their hives and bees at the bottom of the garden. I also don‚Äôt know if the honey will be tasty, creamy or floral.
I just know that these people, dressed like astronauts, stood near their tower and their neighbouring office, are on the move. They are learning about other problems; discovering new fields.
We all play a role in the world in which we live. It‚Äôs up to us to make it better. So, let‚Äôs go! Before we really get stung.‚Äô‚Äô L‚Äôor√© des bois - A√Øe √ßa pique !

description:
¬´¬†Il y a 5 ans mon petit fr√®re a eu un accident de la route. Il est devenu parapl√©gique. J‚Äôavais beaucoup de mal √† trouver des informations fiables pour l‚Äôaider √† retrouver une vie normale. A l‚Äô√©poque, j‚Äôapprenais √† coder. J‚Äôai donc lanc√© un chatbot associ√© √† une API qui centralise plus de 200 000 informations d‚Äôaccessibilit√©. Wilson, le chatbot, renseigne nos utilisateurs sur l‚Äôacc√®s √† l‚Äôemploi, √† la culture, au tourisme, au logement, au sport‚Ä¶ √† l‚Äô√©crit ou √† la voix. Il tient compte de leurs handicaps, de leurs besoins et de leur localisation pour les accompagner au mieux. Il se nourrit √©galement de toutes les demandes pour s‚Äôam√©liorer. Tout l‚Äôint√©r√™t d‚Äôune API est qu‚Äôelle fonctionne comme un tuyau. Elle permet de connecter Wilson aux applications ou aux sites Web qu‚Äôutilisent d√©j√† les personnes handicap√©es. De cette fa√ßon, elles re√ßoivent les infos dont elles ont besoin, o√π qu‚Äôelles soient et o√π qu‚Äôelles aillent. Le monde est grand, il faut pouvoir √™tre spontan√© !¬†¬ª
Audrey Sovignet, co-fondatrice d‚ÄôI Wheel Share
***
‚Äò‚ÄôFive years ago, my little brother had a car accident and became a paraplegic as a result. I had a tough time finding reliable information to help him return to normal life. At that time, I was learning how to code so I launched a chatbot with a connected API which centralizes over 200,000 pieces of information. Wilson, that‚Äôs its name, gives disabled a series of information related to employment, culture, tourism/travel, housing, sport and so on through text messages or voice assistance. The tool takes their disabilities, needs and location into account to provide them with tailor-made support. Any request from users that can improve the quality of services is considered. What makes an API so valuable is that it works as a pipe connecting the chatbot to other applications and websites already used by disabled. This way, they can receive all the information they need wherever they are, wherever they go. The world is so big that we should all be available to be spontaneous.‚Äô‚Äô
Audrey Sovignet, cofounder of I Wheel Share
¬© Vincent Colin
#Code #Chatbot #Handicap #Solidarit√© #Tech4Good #HumanInside

description:
¬´¬†Le num√©rique bouleverse notre vie √† tous et il n‚Äôest pas toujours facile de comprendre la nature ou l‚Äôimpact de ces changements. Quels sont les effets soci√©taux de cette immersion num√©rique de plus en plus forte, qu‚Äôa-t-elle transform√©, amplifi√©, et acc√©l√©r√© par son expansion exponentielle et comment. Ce sont ces questionnements qui ont conduit √† cr√©er le Digital Society Forum il y a cinq ans. Un espace d‚Äô√©changes in√©dit o√π nous favorisons l‚Äôacculturation du plus grand nombre aux enjeux du num√©rique ici et maintenant. Le principe qui pr√©side le projet est que nous ne prenons jamais le num√©rique comme une solution, nous ne sommes pas techno-oriented, nous abordons des
sujets du quotidien comme le num√©rique et la parentalit√©, l‚Äôemploi, l‚Äô√©ducation, la sant√©, la consommation, etc. Avec le Digital Society Forum, en favorisant le d√©bat nous voulons offrir √† chacun la capacit√© de prendre conscience des externalit√©s issues du num√©rique et d‚Äôen tirer profit.¬†¬ª
Thierry Taboy, Directeur des enjeux sociaux et soci√©taux chez Orange.
***
‚Äò‚ÄôTechnology has transformed people‚Äôs everyday lives. In this era, it‚Äôs not always easy to understand the nature of these changes and the impact. What to make of an ever-growing digital world and its social effects?
Which aspect of daily life has been transformed, amplified and accelerated because of the exponential growth of digital technology and how? These questions led to the creation of the Digital Society Forum five years ago. We offer an innovative space for exchanges where as many people as possible can learn about and get more familiar with today‚Äôs digital challenges. The project is based on the following principle: digital technologies must never be presented as a solution. We tackle kitchen table issues from parenting and technology to jobs, education, health care, consumer spending and so on. By encouraging debate within the Digital Society Forum, we want to give everyone the opportunity to raise awareness when it comes to externalities of digital technologies and make the best of them.‚Äô‚Äô
Thierry Taboy, social and society issues director at Orange
#DigitalInclusion #InclusionNum√©rique #LifeAtOrange #HumanInside

description:
¬´ Je suis une fille de la terre, attentive √† l'environnement. Ce qui se passe aujourd'hui m'effraie, me stup√©fie. L'air n'est plus respirable, en apn√©e, je retiens mon souffle. Je ferme les yeux, je cherche le calme. Le monde aquatique est serein, tranquille et silencieux. Ma nouvelle facult√©, l'apn√©e, me permet de l'explorer et de retrouver une paix int√©rieure. Je commence donc √† l'explorer. Tant bien que mal, j'adapte mes pratiques √† mon nouveau monde. Le v√©lo ? Pourquoi pas. Maintenant, je suis une fille de la mer. ¬ª
***
‚ÄúI am a daughter of the land, environmentally-aware. What is happening today frightens and amazes me. I cannot breathe the air, underwater, I hold my breath. I close my eyes, I seek peace and quiet. The water is calm, still and silent. My new ability ‚Äì holding my breath ‚Äì allows me to explore and find an inner peace. I start to explore. Somehow, I adapt to my new world. The bicycle? Why not. Now I am a daughter of the sea.‚Äù

description:
¬´ La r√©volution digitale a permis de franchir une nouvelle √©tape dans la d√©mocratisation de l‚Äôart. C‚Äôest dans ce but que nous avons cr√©√© l‚Äô@uma.museum (Universal Museum of Art), un mus√©e virtuel accessible partout et pour tous depuis son smartphone, sa tablette ou son ordinateur. Et la quasi omnipr√©sence dans le monde de la 3G contribue au succ√®s de ce projet. Nous faisons voyager l‚Äôart aux quatre coins de la plan√®te, en cr√©ant des expositions qui n‚Äôauraient jamais pu voir le jour dans un mus√©e. Le rendu est encore plus spectaculaire car nous pouvons recr√©er des palais, des villes, des sc√©nographies et des contenus uniques. La r√©alit√© virtuelle nous permet √©galement de faire (re)d√©couvrir l‚Äôart de mani√®re plus immersive et de faire revivre les √©motions √©prouv√©es face √† une ≈ìuvre. C‚Äôest extr√™mement fort. Demain, avec le d√©veloppement de l‚ÄôIA, nous esp√©rons aller encore plus loin et pourquoi pas proposer des expositions sur mesure en fonction des go√ªts de chacun. ¬ª
Jean Verg√®s, co-fondateur et CEO de UMA
***
"The digital revolution brings us a lot closer to a complete democratization of Art. This worthy purpose was in our mind when we created UMA (Universal Museum of Art), a virtual museum for all, accessible on a smartphone, tablet or computer from anywhere. The nearly full 3G worldwide coverage has a great impact on the success of the project. We make art pieces travel from one part of the globe to another by putting together exhibitions that wouldn‚Äôt have been possible to set up in a (physical) museum. Displays are even more spectacular as we can redesign palaces, cities, scenographies and unique contents. Through virtual reality, we rediscover art in a more immersive way, we recapture the emotion all of us feel in front of an artwork. That‚Äôs very powerful. In the future, we hope to take full advantage of the progress made in AI to go even further and, let‚Äôs say, offer tailor-made exhibitions to virtual visitors based on their own artistic tastes."
Jean Verges, co-founder and CEO of UMA
¬© Vincent Colin
#AI #art #VR #IA #museum #HumanInside

description:
¬´¬†Rendre service n‚Äôa rien d‚Äôune nouveaut√© mais aujourd‚Äôhui avec l‚Äôaide d‚Äôoutils tels que l‚ÄôIA, la big data ou les algorithmes, nous pouvons changer l‚Äô√©chelle de notre impact. Gr√¢ce √† un usage malin des nouvelles technologies, l‚Äôapplication permet d‚Äôeffectuer un diagnostic 360 et personnalis√© de sa recherche d‚Äôemploi pour donner aux utilisateurs les cl√©s n√©cessaires √† leur r√©insertion professionnelle. ‚ÄúProviding a service is nothing new. But today, with the help of tools like AI, big data and algorithms, we can change the extent of our impact. description:
¬´¬†Devenir volontaire civique est une mani√®re de m‚Äôengager dans un projet dans lequel je crois, au service de la collectivit√©. Mon choix s‚Äôest naturellement port√© sur le FunLab ‚Äî le laboratoire de fabrication num√©rique de l‚Äôassociation FUN (Fabrique d‚ÄôUsages Num√©riques) ‚Äî pour aider ses adh√©rents √† se former aux usages num√©riques et lutter contre l‚Äôexclusion. Cr√©√© √† l‚Äôinitiative de citoyens, c‚Äôest un lieu qui met √† disposition de tous des outils de fabrication num√©rique pour concr√©tiser tout type d‚Äôenvie : imprimantes 3D, mat√©riel √©lectronique, logiciels, etc. Mais c‚Äôest aussi une communaut√© qui partage des connaissances et un espace d‚Äôapprentissage. Ing√©nieurs, bidouilleurs en herbe, artistes, entrepreneurs ou simple curieux, chacun dispose de comp√©tences num√©riques dont les autres peuvent b√©n√©ficier. Aujourd‚Äôhui, je suis tr√®s fi√®re de cette exp√©rience humaine et moi-m√™me adh√©rente du FunLab pour mettre sur pied mes projets personnels.¬†¬ª 
Shana Fils-Aim√©, volontaire civique du FunLab
***
‚ÄúBecoming a volunteer was a way to get involved in a project I believe in, serving a local community. I naturally chose FunLab ‚Äî the digital manufacturing lab of the FUN (Fabrique d‚ÄôUsages Num√©riques/ Digital Manufacturing Workshop) nonprofit ‚Äî to help its members learn how to use digital tools and combat exclusion. It is a citizen initiative and it‚Äôs a place that provides access to all digital manufacturing tools to bring all sorts of things to life: there are 3D printers, electronic equipment, software, etc. But it is also a community where knowledge is shared, and a learning space. Engineers, DIY hacks, artists, entrepreneurs or just simply curious people, everyone has digital skills that others can benefit from. Today, I‚Äôm very proud of this human experience and about the fact that I am now a member of the FunLab and I can bring my own projects to life.‚Äù
